intro: Indigofera spicata var. brevicarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited indigofera, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the legume family. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures. Its growth habit includes both shrub and herbaceous forms, depending on environmental conditions.
